selected_quotes: Gage Crump colleagues define a unique bone differentiation and repair programme
@NYTScience zebrafish also display tissue-specific stem based regeneration. If depends mostly on the tissue.

citation.abstract: The healing of bone often involves a cartilage intermediate, yet how such cartilage is induced and utilized during repair is not fully understood. By studying a model of large-scale bone regeneration in the lower jaw of adult zebrafish, we show that chondrocytes are critical for generating thick bone during repair. During jawbone regeneration, we find that chondrocytes co-express genes associated with osteoblast differentiation and produce extensive mineralization, which is in marked contrast to chondrocytes during facial skeletal development. We also identify the likely source of repair chondrocytes as a population of Runx2+, Sp7- cells that emanate from the periosteum, a tissue that normally contributes only osteoblasts during homeostasis. Analysis of ihha mutants shows that the ability of periosteal cells to generate cartilage in response to injury depends on a repair-specific role of Ihha in the induction as opposed to the proliferation of chondrocytes. The large-scale regeneration of the zebrafish jawbone thus employs a cartilage differentiation program distinct from that seen during development, with the bone-forming potential of repair chondrocytes potentially due to their derivation from osteogenic cells in the periosteum.
citation.publisher: Oxford University Press for The Company of Biologists Limited
citation.title: Ihha induces hybrid cartilage-bone cells during zebrafish jawbone regeneration

news.title: Repair cartilage potentially can heal horribly broken bones
news.summary: Stem cells could one day be stimulated to make a special type of cartilage to help repair large, hard-to-heal bone fractures - a potential boon for doctors treating big-money athletes, USC researchers say.

Indian hedgehog directs a distinct programme for bone regeneration
